Issues.Title: Add Official Schematics documentation
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
Hello. I just spend some time creating my first schematics. Have to say it's awesome! Unfortunately, I had to spend much of my time reading throughout the angular @schematics code to see examples of how it works and articles on Medium by other people about how to create a basic schematic.

It would be awesome if the Angular team spends some time making an awesome documentation of such an awesome feature! This has so much potential to be wildly used, and I'm afraid that without proper documentation, it won't reach the masses!

Just try to google a simple example of `How to copy a file in angular schematics`, and there is no simple link to it. I ended up reading a file via the `tree.read` into a `buffer`, transforming the file into a `string`, and then creating a new one via `tree.create`, but don't even know if this is standard or not ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è 

In any case, I love schematics, but there is no official documentation at all other than two blog post (one with unit test) with simple examples you guys created in the Angular Medium Blog.

Thanks! Nice job!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add Official Schematics documentation" (#29241)

Issues.Title: ng build --deploy-url does not work on scripts added through lazy loading or Service Workers
Issues.Body:
If I run this command:

```sh
ng build --deploy-url=https://cdn.acme.com/assets/
```

Then I expect my all of the scripts that are added dynamically to use that deploy URL, like this:

```html
<script charset="utf-8" src="https://cdn.acme.com/assets/lazy-loaded-module.213123.js"></script>
```

I get this instead:

```html
<script charset="utf-8" src="/assets/lazy-loaded-module.213123.js"></script>
```

I have a bundling process in my backend server on startup that will upload all assets to CloudFront global CDN, and since I can't seem to hook into the URLs for lazy-loaded modules, I'm not able to upload the to the CDN in production and as such my scripts are loaded from file server in the backend API, which I no longer want to support as I want to use CloudFront for serving all static assets.

I also have same issue with the Service Worker files.

Please advise.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng build --deploy-url does not work on scripts added through lazy loading or Service Workers" (#29240)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): use default selector for Components if selector is empty
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change default selector for Components was not applied in case selector is missing or defined as an empty string. This update aligns this behavior between Ivy and VE: now default selector is used for Components when it's needed. Directives with empty selector are not allowed and trigger a compile-time error in both Ivy and VE.

This PR resolves FW-1157.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): use default selector for Components if selector is empty" (#29239)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): inherit param types when class has a constructor which‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ takes no declared parameters and delegates up

In ReflectionCapabilities, when checking for own parameters of a type, inherit the types properly for classes that do have a constructor, but the constructor takes no declared parameters and just delegates to super(...arguments). This removes the need to declare trivial constructors in such classes to make them work properly in JIT mode. Without this, DI fails and injectables are undefined.

Issues.Title: Add file structure section to Creating Libraries
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

The new [Project Files Structure](https://angular.io/guide/file-structure) page for v8 references [Creating Libraries](https://angular.io/guide/creating-libraries) for more information on the file structure of libraries. 

To make the reference true, we need to add a file-structure section to [Creating Libraries](https://angular.io/guide/creating-libraries) guide. The structure will change in v8, so that should be the target. 

### What's the affected URL? 

 [Creating Libraries](https://angular.io/guide/creating-libraries) 

Possibly also add a more specific reference to [Project Files Structure](https://angular.io/guide/file-structure).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add file structure section to Creating Libraries" (#29225)

Issues.Title: element ID's are truncated during angular processing to a length of no more than 20
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package I do not know. ### Is this a regression? I do not believe it is. ### Description Angular appears to be truncating the ID of an element when processing it to a length not greater than 20. Inspect element at following stackblitz.com. The set id in the code is truncated once angular processes it. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-vx8rji?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html ## üî• Exception or Error 



None
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular 7.2.8
**Anything else relevant?** I regularly use the GUID of the row as an ID when I need to get it a unique reproducible id for things like tooltips and other controls. This truncates that ID. In any case, this seems to be arbitrarirly low limit given the w3c spec has no limit. I realize there needs to be a practical limit but it would be helpful if it was closer to 50 rather that 20.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "element ID's are truncated during angular processing to a length of no more than 20" (#29222)

Issues.Title: Bug in create_url_tree.ts
Issues.Body:
Routing fails, if null is provided as routing parameter.

To resolve this, check your function createNewSegmentGroup(segmentGroup, startIndex, commands) {...} on line 272 (https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/router/src/create_url_tree.ts#L272 / commit https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/091a504377782b9338a9d7916f84fb18c5bbdcc2) and check additionally `commands[i]` for not null.

Issues.Title: Angular Library
Issues.Body:
This is a feature request for Angular Libraries

I am currently having to loading an entire library, when I only need a service inside it.

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/compiler-cli

### Description

Wrong TypeScript declaration file.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

package.json:
```json
{
  "name": "compiler-cli-declarations-bug",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "main": "index.js",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@angular/compiler": "7.2.8",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "7.2.8",
    "@types/node": "11.11.0",
    "typescript": "3.3.3333"
  }
}
```

index.ts:
```typescript
import {readConfiguration} from "@angular/compiler-cli";

console.log(typeof readConfiguration);

```

Command to execute:
```
npx tsc --strict --noEmitOnError --lib es2015,dom index.ts
```

## üî• Exception or Error
```
node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/index.d.ts:20:10 - error TS2305: Module '"@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtools_api"' has no exported member 'NgTools_InternalApi_NG_2'.

20 export { NgTools_InternalApi_NG_2 as __NGTOOLS_PRIVATE_API_2 } from './src/ngtools_api';
            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Found 2 errors.
```

![img](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1560781/54127946-ff53d280-441b-11e9-86c9-27de7db9e57d.png)

## Anything else relevant?

Adding `--skipLibCheck` TypeScript compiler option is a workaround:
```
npx tsc --strict --noEmitOnError --lib es2015,dom --skipLibCheck index.ts
```

Issues.Title: writeValue gets called before ngOnInit
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/forms` ### Is this a regression? I don't know. I don't think so. ### Description When `NgControl` is injected into the constructor of a component and the value accessor is set manually to avoid `cyclic dependency errors`, `writeValue` is called before `ngOnInit`. Issues.Title: Navigation with custom Animation and :Increment :decrement does not work as expected
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Description We try to create a lazy loaded wizzard/stepper using router and custom navigation. We register a custom animation named **loginRouteSlideInAnimation** which has an `:increment` and `:decrement` transition What we do, when we go to next page we would like to slide in new page from right and if we go to previous page we would like to slide in new page from right. We do this with this custom animation trigger The strange thing is, if we run this locally with ng serve the navigation animation is not working as expected, go to NEXT page does not perform any animation until we go on a PREVIOUS page and also from the other side, on first PREVIOUS page does not perform any animation until we go on NEXT page. What we can see `(query(':enter))` has no results in the situation where the animation is not working. But it should! You can test the app on stackblitz, where the APP is working well. But please clone our repo and check it locally where it is not working as expected and like in the stackblitz. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/github/mburger81/test-animation https://github.com/mburger81/test-animation
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navigation with custom Animation and :Increment :decrement does not work as expected" (#29216)

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [x] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
When there is already a merge conflict upon creation of a PR, the circle CI "setup" task fails with a cryptic error.

Issue Number: #29199


## What is the new behavior?
Properly merge PRs, and throw a descriptive error message about the rebase conflict.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: Navigating back in iframe in IE is not recognized by router
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Given that this a routing issue I assume `@angular/router` is the cause. ### Is this a regression? I am not sure if this issue occurred in earlier versions, but as the application migrated form 5 -> 6 (after we implemented the routing feature, see below) some time ago, I can only guess that with Angular 5 routing worked as expected. Otherwise the error would have been noticed earlier. ### Description I am currently developing a micro-frontend website which uses iframes to load different applications into it. The architecture of the project can be best described visually: ![iframe-setup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18900196/53732941-b4681700-3e7f-11e9-868e-4bb22ed0b8d8.png) The issue here is the inner iframe. If it navigates to some route, say from `module/route` to `module/feat` the history is filled correctly, so both URLs will be in the history. However, if I click the browser back button and the state is popped, Angular in the inner iframe will fail to detect the URL change. I have verified, that the URL of the iframe is correct by executing `iframe.contentWindow.location.href`. Same holds true if I inject `Location` from `@angular/common`. All other browsers (including Edge) detect the URL change and correctly open the previous route. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction This is where it becomes tricky. I created a minimal setup on Gitlab: https://gitlab.com/Znert/angular-iframe-navigation-bug However, this project does **not** reproduce the error. If you start the project and navigate inside the iframe and go back, everything works fine. Hence all I can provide you with is a link to our (German) production site: [onfarming.at](https://onfarming.at) If you want to reproduce the error there, you have to sign in/up first (using Google, Facbeook or just use a throwaway email - just fill the fields `E-Mail Adresse`, `Passwort` and `Passwort wiederholen`, I guess you can figure out which requires what). Then you will come to the dashboard. The easiest way to navigate within iframes is if you click on "Pflanzenschutz". Once there, use the search in the top card "Produkte finden" and enter "amistar opti". Click on any match. This will cause a navigate to the product detail page. Now you can press the back button ("Zur√ºck") on the top left of the iframe, or the browser back. Nothing will happen. Validate, that the iframe's url changed by getting the (only) iframe on the page and call `iframe.contentWindow.location.href`. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** All our micro-frontends have been upgraded to Angular 7 recently, but the error occurred while on 6 as well. The following output is of one of the inner micro-frontends, but the versions are pretty much identical between each other: 

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 7.3.2
Node: 8.14.1
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.2.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.13.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.2
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.13.2
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.13.2
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.2
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.2
@angular/cli                      7.3.2
@ngtools/webpack                  7.3.2
@schematics/angular               7.3.2
@schematics/update                0.13.2
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.29.0
**Anything else relevant?** This issue was found on IE 11 on Windows 10. Older versions of IE and Windows have not been tested. Other browser do not have the issue (to the best of my knowledge). I researched the topic and found the following two relevant posts: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/15513159/ https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/9497 However, neither of them provide a solution (and the second one even is for AngularJS...).

Issues.Title: Update Node.js version minimum to 10
Issues.Body:
Node.js 8 is now in maintenance LTS status and will be EOL in December 2019.  Node.js 10 is now the active LTS version with Node.js 12 due for arrival in April 2019.  Node.js 10+ provides an improved performance baseline as well as access to newer Node.js APIs and Javascript language features which the Angular CLI will now be able to leverage.

ref: https://nodejs.org/en/about/releases/

The minimum npm version was also synchronized with the version bundled with the new minimum Node.js version.
Also fixes several type issues related to the updated Node.js API.

Issues.Title: the library schematic generates a file name which isn't camel-case
Issues.Body:
By convention, files follow the kebab-case convention except (at least) for `public_api.ts`.

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/0715beb65c037992b5295ec1417f80cfd2fc890c/packages/schematics/angular/library/schema.json#L18-L22

Should not we change it following the kebab-case convention ? Currently, the documentation refers to a file named `index.ts` which is wrong. (PR https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/29200).

cc @gkalpak
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "the library schematic generates a file name which isn't camel-case" (#13862)

Issues.Title: Ng Build doesn't always fill Errors array for the Webpack 'done' hook
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When using Webpack `done` hook together with `ng build --watch` command, the `stats` object, passed to the hook as a parameter doesn't always have `stats.compilation.errors` array filled even if there are errors and the build has failed. Although it could be seen as a minor issue, it makes impossible using of popup build notifiers like the `webpack-notifier` because these rely on errors presence in the `stats` object. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The sample code could be found at [https://github.com/Usurer/bugreports.NgCliBuildWebpackHooks](https://github.com/Usurer/bugreports.NgCliBuildWebpackHooks) * Create a new Angular app via `ng new my-app` * Create a simple Webpack plugin that would use the `done` [hook](https://webpack.js.org/api/compiler-hooks/#done): ```javascript var MyWebpackPlugin = module.exports = function() {}; MyWebpackPlugin.prototype.compilationDone = function(stats) { console.log('Errors:'); console.info(stats.compilation.errors); }; MyWebpackPlugin.prototype.apply = function(compiler) { if (compiler.hooks) { var plugin = { name: 'My Plugin' }; compiler.hooks.done.tap(plugin, this.compilationDone.bind(this)); } else { compiler.plugin('done', this.compilationDone.bind(this)); } }; ``` * Add custom webpack config by following [instructions](https://github.com/manfredsteyer/ngx-build-plus) for `ngx-build-plus`: * run `ng add ngx-build-plus` * add `webpack.partial.js` to the project root with the following contents: ```javascript const MyWebpackPlugin = require('./myWebpackPlugin'); module.exports = { plugins: [ new MyWebpackPlugin() ] } ``` * run `ng build --watch --extra-webpack-config webpack.partial.js` Result as expected: no build errors and an empty errors array logged to console. * Now open `/src/app/app.component.ts` and add the following new line to the end of the file: `xxx;` * Check the build console. Expected: "Cannot find name xxx" error logged twice - as a part of an error object in an errors array and as a regular build error message. Actual: errors array logged as an empty array, "Cannot find name xxx" error is shown in the console as a regular build error message. * Now cancel the `build --watch`. Make sure that you still have an `xxx` line in the `app.component.ts` and run `ng build --watch --extra-webpack-config webpack.partial.js` again. * Check the build console. Result as expected: "Cannot find name xxx" error logged twice - as a part of an error object in an errors array and as a regular build error message. * Remove the `xxx` line and check the console. Result as expected: Errors array is empty, build succeeded. * Once again add the `xxx` line and check the console Expected: "Cannot find name xxx" error logged twice - as a part of an error object in an errors array and as a regular build error message. Actual: errors array logged as an empty array, "Cannot find name xxx" error is shown in the console as a regular build error message. ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: build: update @bazel/karma to version ~0.27.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| @​bazel/karma | devDependencies | minor | [`~0.26.0` -> `~0.27.0`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/@bazel/karma/0.26.0/0.27.3) | [source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/tree/HEAD/packages/karma) |
| @​bazel/typescript | devDependencies | minor | [`~0.26.0` -> `~0.27.0`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/@bazel/typescript/0.26.0/0.27.3) | [source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/tree/HEAD/packages/typescript) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>bazelbuild/rules_nodejs</summary>

### [`v0.27.3`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/0.27.3)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/0.27.2...0.27.3)

`jasmine_node_test` now support the `shard_count` attribute, to parallelize the specs in the test. See <https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/be/common-definitions.html#common-attributes-tests>

fixed the dependencies of `@bazel/typescript` to not include `jasmine-core`

### [`v0.27.2`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/0.27.1...0.27.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/0.27.1...0.27.2)

### [`v0.27.1`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/0.27.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/0.27.0...0.27.1)

minor bugfix for [@​bazel/typescript](https://togithub.com/bazel/typescript) API doc pipeline

### [`v0.27.0`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/0.27.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/0.26.0...0.27.0)

-   yarn default is now 1.13.0

#### [@​bazel/typescript](https://togithub.com/bazel/typescript)

-   Fix docs formatting issues and include some missing attributes (switched from Skydoc to Stardoc)

#### rollup_bundle

-   Update to latest rollup, including support for tree-shaking `@__PURE__` code
-   Include the rollup-plugin-commonjs so that commonjs-format modules can be bundled
-   Update from uglify to terser, the currently supported JS minifier, which handles ES2015 inputs
-   The es2015 output is now using native ES modules, so no runtime loader is required (system.js). Note that rollup has a new polyfill, `s.js` which is not demonstrated here yet.
-   Output chunk directories renamed from `*.cs` to `*_chunks` and from `.es6` to `_es2015` (BREAKING if you depended on the names)

To use this release, update your `WORKSPACE` to:

```python
http_archive(
    name = "build_bazel_rules_nodejs",
    urls = ["https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/download/0.27.0/rules_nodejs-0.27.0.tar.gz"],
    sha256 = "b1c8d0aeb55aced7b56c3c2a661b3df8210ac81368c39f6287052ee430450fe6",
)
```

and update your `@bazel/typescript`, `@bazel/karma`, and `@bazel/jasmine` dependencies to 0.27.0

</details>

Issues.Title: Problem with AngularUniversal schematic
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [x ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? I don't know ### Description Usage of `ng add @nguniversal/express-engine` does not guarantee Angular Universal app to be ready. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Establish new angular project with CLI: `ng new derek6 --style=scss --routing` 2. Generate SSR with related schematic: `ng add @nguniversal/express-engine --clientProject derek6` 3. Go to default port, which app is served on: `http://localhost:4000`. Schematics runner can accept a JavsScript file as a `factory` of a schematic.

Issues.Title: Extensions
Issues.Body:
Rolling this forward with a README explaining our agreed-on policy.

@cyrilletuzi we want to find a fair way to include extensions from the community, including yours. We are stuck on how to do this without confusing users with a set of overlapping extensions - we assume that many users will install all of our recommendations. That forces us to pick winners and that's not a good position for us to be in.
The governance constraint is the primary one we'll use for guidance in version 8. So the easiest path to get your code in front of users is to make it first-party.
Happy to discuss further.

/fyi @mrmeku

Issues.Title: fix(table): use default change detection strategy on table
Issues.Body:
[Note: This change includes formatting changes as well as the actual code changes. The only change is that Default change detection strategy will be used instead of OnPush for table and row components.]

This resolves an issue with Ivy where change detection was not reflecting binding changes made to the row and cell templates in the component declaring the table.

In View Engine, change detection for a dynamically created view runs in two cases:
1) When the view in which it was inserted is checked
2) When the view in which it was declared is checked

As a result, if a dynamic view is inserted into an OnPush component, that view is not actually checked only "on push". It is also checked as often as its declaration view is checked (even if the insertion view is explicitly detached from change detection).

For this reason, marking `MatTable` as "OnPush" doesn't have much of an effect. It is built almost entirely of views that are declared elsewhere, so its change detection frequency is dependent on those declaration views. It also doesn't have any bindings inside its own view that would be protected by "OnPush", so marking it this way is effectively a noop and can be removed without performance regressions.

In Ivy, this change detection loophole has been closed, so  declaration views can no longer de-optimize OnPush components. This means bindings inherited from declaration views aren't updated by default if `MatTable` is OnPush (the embedded view would need to be marked dirty explicitly).

To avoid breaking changes when we transition to Ivy, it makes more sense to perpetuate the current behavior by removing the "OnPush" marker. As delineated earlier, this has no impact on View Engine. For Ivy, it would ensure bindings inherited from the declaration view are still checked by default.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(table): use default change detection strategy on table" (#15440)

Issues.Title: fix(schematics): do not run migrations multiple times
Issues.Body:
Currently when someone runs the update schematic within a CLI project,
the migration could be executed multiple times for the same `tsconfig` path
This can happen because the `getProjectTsConfigPaths` function _can_
incorrectly return the same tsconfig multiple times. The paths are not properly
deduped as we don't normalize the determined project tsconfig paths.

e.g. `/tsconfig.json` exists and the common tsconfig path is detected. At the same time the
workspace configuration specifies `tsconfig.json` in the project options. Both paths refer
to the same tsconfig project, but are different strings and therefore aren't filtered out
by the `Set` which contains all possible tsconfig locations --> migrations are executed
for both paths.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(schematics): do not run migrations multiple times" (#15424)

Issues.Title: writeValue gets called before ngOnInit
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
`ngOnInit` should be called before `writeValue`

#### What is the current behavior?
`writeValue` gets called before `ngOnInit` when the value accessor is set directly as described in the [docs](https://material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control#-code-ngcontrol-code-) under `ngControl`, i.e. by using
```
if (this.ngControl != null) {
    this.ngControl.valueAccessor = this;
}
```
in the constructor to avoid `cyclic dependency error` when providing `NG_VALUE_ACCESSOR`.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-form-control-bug)


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular/Material: 7.2.8

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "writeValue gets called before ngOnInit" (#15434)

Issues.Title: refactor(stepper): rework buttons to handle Ivy
Issues.Body:
In Ivy inheriting `host` bindings works correctly by merging the two declarations, whereas in ViewEngine the bindings aren't inherited at all. This means that with our current setup the `click` listener on the buttons will be invoked twice with Ivy.

These changes rework the buttons so that they work both with Ivy and ViewEngine.

Issues.Title: Placeholder Disappearing From Option/Select  When Options Are Reset
Issues.Body:
I have two select fields, the second of which options depend on the value of the first. When the options of the second are reset and the placeholder text disappears until you interact with the form field. 

#### What is the expected behavior?
I'm expecting the placeholder value to be shown when the options reset.

#### What is the current behavior?
The placeholder value disappears.


#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/select-issue

Select Liquid Flavor from the Product Form field then choose any option from the Product Type. Next, change the option in the first field to Powder Flavor - the second field clears out.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7, Material 7, Chrome on Windows

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I noticed that the the event triggers something that adds the .mat-form-field-hide-placeholder class to the form field. But that's as far as I have been able to get. I would love a point in the right direction on how to troubleshoot this.

Issues.Title: mat-select swallows click outside when open
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? Clicking anything outside the mat-select (when open) should receive the click event. #### What is the current behavior? mat-select is swallowing the click event when it is open. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
Can reproduce on the material site: https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview open Basic mat-select by clicking it. now click the Basic native select box. It closes the Basic mat-select but does not open the Basic native select. you have to click it twice to register the click on the Basic native select. But now open the Basic native select, then click the Basic mat-select box. one click closes the Basic native select and opens the basic mat-select - as expected. My particular use case involves the multi-select mat-select box, where the user selects an option and the dropdown is not closed. Then they click on an accept changes button. They have to click it twice to register the click on the button while the mat-select dropdown is still open. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? 7.3.1 is showing on the angular material site at: https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview #### Is there anything else we should know? My particular use case involves the multi-select mat-select box, where the user selects an option and the dropdown is not closed. Then they click on an accept changes button. They have to click it twice to register the click on the button while the mat-select dropdown is still open.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select swallows click outside when open" (#15416)
